summary.para: Starts the application shell based on this application descriptor and theService Provider of the Visual Studio instance.
The is expected to be True after this method returns. It's an error to call this method if already is True.
See notes on for info on how Shells and Application Descriptors work together, and how this method should be implemented.

summary.para: Initializes the component. Called by the component container after the component is created.
is the pairing method that's guaranteed to be called by the component container to tear down your component.
You must not access other components before your method is called.
All of the components that you access from are guaranteed to exist when your is called. Any other component might be missing by that time, and trying to get it will throw an exception.

member.name: F:JetBrains.ReSharper.VS.SolutionBuilder.VsSolutionBuilder.myIsReportingErrors
member.summary: This is a supplementary component to wind up VS builds and track their progress. Therefore, most of its warnings are non-fatal, even though we should be aware of them and should try to fix them. Set up by Ctor, tells whether we're reporting non-fatal errors.
